cab.content: From Sir P. Cox, Baghdad, 20th April 1917.[Addressed to Foreign and repeated to Secretary of State for India andPolitical, Basra.)(Received at India Office 21st April, 10.30 a.m.)[P1661] T. 1254. Secretary of Stated telegram dated 12th. April. Mesopotamia administration. Baghdad Vilayet. Following is result of analysis of administrative appointments (?); (1) Executive personnel, i.e., Deputy Wali, Mutessarifs, Putakams, Mudirs, about 50 in number ; half of them Turks. All have gone.(2) Administrative personnel. About 120 in number. All leading officials were Turks, numbering about 20 ; they have all gone. Remaining 100 were non-Turks of various denominations ; 48 remain. Turks were careful to take away in particular any officials who might be expected to be of use to us.
